snippet: After crushing the Muslim Brotherhood, the generals in Cairo who are running the government are now going after liberals and journalists.
abstract: Editorial warns Egypt's military-controlled government is expanding a repressive system that may ultimately be worse than the one former dictator Hosni Mubarak built; notes regime has moved from singling out members of the Muslim Brotherhood and other Islamists to going after liberal and left-leaning activists and journalists; urges Obama administration to withhold money from Egypt, given the government's insistence on repression.
lead_paragraph: After crushing the Muslim Brotherhood, the generals in Cairo who are running the government are now going after liberals and journalists.

headline.main: Who Will Be Left in Egypt?
headline.print_headline: Who Will Be Left in Egypt?

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
